questions.questionText: What is the vanishing gradient problem in deep learning?
choices: When gradients become too large during training
When gradients become too small, making it hard to train deep networks
When the learning rate is too high
When the model has too few layers
Learning from labeled examples
Learning through rewards and penalties in an environment
Learning by clustering data
Learning from textbooks

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of backpropagation in neural networks?
choices: To feed data forward through the network
To adjust weights by propagating errors backward through the network
To initialize random weights
To evaluate the final output

questions.questionText: What is a convolutional neural network (CNN) primarily used for?
choices: Text analysis
Image recognition and processing
Time series prediction
Database management

questions.questionText: What is the 'bias-variance tradeoff' in machine learning?
choices: The balance between model complexity and generalization performance
The choice between accuracy and speed
The difference between training and testing time
The tradeoff between memory and CPU usage
